evidence.text:
Person A: If it was me, I’d just move out of the building, forfeit my deposit. I couldn’t live next to that. Every time you step outside, not knowing if he’s gonna be there. Always being on guard - Jesus. I’d have nightmares.
Person A: I sure as hell do mean it, and I don’t feel bad about it either. Humans are hard-wired to fear and despise the sick and the ugly. Used to leave deformed babies out to die in the cold. Put ‘em in institutions at least. I’ve got science on my side. You know it’s true, but you’re just being politically...

Person B: Good. Hey...that photo..is that you, as a boy?
Person A: Yeah.
Person A: You have an eyelash. Let me get it. She touches his eye. He grabs her hand and holds it in place. They stare at each other. Edward leans in to kiss her.
Person B: It’s just no one’s ever touched my...my...face...before...
Person B: I know, always so helpful, aren’t you? I don’t want your pity. I know that I disgust you.

Person B: You think I don’t know what your little friends say about me? “Why do you hang out with that, that freak. He’ll get the wrong idea.” But you...you’re the worst of all...with your kindness and caring and fussing and...God, how I hate you.
Person B: I’m Edward! You’re not Edward!
